body: Always use the lang="" attribute in the HTML tag to set the language and optional country of the page. -->
<!-- Define the use of Open Graph
Open Graph is used to give users the relevant content when sharing on a social platform.
"The Open Graph protocol enables any web page to become a rich object in a social graph.
For instance, this is used on Facebook to allow any web page to have the same functionality as any other object on Facebook."
Define the vertical in prefix="og: https://ogp.me/ns/vertical#"> where vertical is replaced by eg. website, video, music...
More information on verticals on https://ogp.me/
<!-- OPTIONAL WHEN NEEDED: Use conditional commenting to target IE browsers with CSS (or even JS... ).
You should not use this but you can. If you must. Add classes in css to target specific browsers.
Set class="no-js" in the html tag. Use the class to add additional styling in CSS that targets browsers that do not support javascript.
Modernizr uses this class and will change it from no-js to js if javascript is supported.
==> Consult https://gs.statcounter.com/browser-market-share to check browser usage for your target region -->
<!--[if lt IE 7]>      <html lang="en-US" prefix="og: https://ogp.me/ns#" class="no-js lt-ie9 lt-ie8 lt-ie7">  <![endif]-->
<!--[if IE 7]>         <html lang="en-US" prefix="og: https://ogp.me/ns#" class="no-js lt-ie9 lt-ie8">         <![endif]-->
<!--[if IE 8]>         <html lang="en-US" prefix="og: https://ogp.me/ns#" class="no-js lt-ie9">                <![endif]-->
<!-- Set the charset used on this page.
Any inline script will be evaluated and executed immediaty.
Any linked script will be executed as soon as it is loaded.
Scripts without async or defer can block rendering untill they are loaded.
Load only scripts here that are needed before rendering.
All relative src attributes will be relative to the base URL.
Use the target attribute to define default window behavior (Default behavior if ommitted is '_self').
==> Open Graph tags do not acknowledge <base>, and should always have full absolute URLs. -->
Preconnect to any domains that hold resources that need to be loaded before the browser starts rendering.
Preload any resources that are needed to render content. Preloading does not execute, it needs another link to the object to execute it!
Example: preload google font *2, *5: section *3 needs to be uncommented to execute the css.
<!-- Another option is to change the rel attribute of the preload as soon as possible: -->
document.getElementById('css').setAttribute('rel', 'stylesheet'); // ==> Add the ID to the preload link.
Always add a canonical URL, even if it is the same as the page url!
"The rel=canonical element, often called the “canonical link”, helps webmasters prevent duplicate content issues.
It does this by specifying the “canonical URL”, the “preferred” version of a web page – the original source, even.
Using it will improve a site’s SEO."
<!-- Set the viewport to device width and zoom level to O.
This is important for responsive pages.
Don't add a maximum-scale value to solve landscape scaling in safari. It blocks zooming!
Add -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; to the HTML tag instead. Normalize.css does this.
Better for SEO. Default robots behavior is INDEX, FOLLOW.
Anything else, you should add. http://www.robotstxt.org/meta.html -->
Title is very important for SEO. -->
Description is very important for SEO -->
<meta name="description" content="BoilerHTML is an extensive HTML5 boilerplate that can be used a starter for any HTML web page.">
Keywords are ignored by Google and Bing.
Bing is using them to classify spamming websites? -->
<meta name="keywords" content="HTML, boilerplate, htmlboilerplate, HTML template, HTML starter">
<!-- Set the minimum Open Graph tags.
Optional tags and more information about the use of open graph tags on http://ogp.me/
<meta property="og:title" content="BoilerHTML.com | A very extensive HTML5 boilerplate.">
<meta property="og:description" content="BoilerHTML is an extensive HTML5 boilerplate that can be used a starter for any website.">

"With Twitter cards, you can attach rich photos, videos and media experiences to Tweets, helping to drive traffic to your website. Simply add a few lines of markup to your webpage, and users who Tweet links to your content will have a “card” added to the Tweet that’s visible to their followers."
Other tags and more information on twitter cards on https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-for-websites/cards/overview/abouts-cards

Twitter cards can use Open Graph tags too. Defining twitter card tags gives more control over the card type and content: https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-for-websites/cards/overview/markup -->
<meta name="twitter:site" content="@boilerHTML"> <!-- twitter username card is attributed to -->
<meta name="twitter:creator" content="@performanize"> <!-- twitter username of content creator. Used with summary_large_image cards -->
<meta name="twitter:title" content="BoilerHTML.com | A very extensive HTML5 boilerplate." />
<meta name="twitter:description" content="BoilerHTML is an extensive HTML5 boilerplate that can be used a starter for any website." />
<!-- Use schema.org (https://schema.org/docs/gs.html) to create structured data for the pages of your website.

Schema.org provides a collection of shared vocabularies webmasters can use to mark up their pages in ways that can be understood by the major search engines: Google, Microsoft, Yandex and Yahoo!. HTML provides information on how pages look. Structured data provides information about what the content is.
Consider designing an alternative to the generated images!
Use http://iconogen.com to generate a complete set. -->
<!-- Set Microsoft tile definition for IE and legacy Edge
==> TODO: find out if New edge uses the too???
Don't add msapplication stuff as meta tags since they are only needed by a browser that supports them.
This avoids that every user has to downmoad the tags. Adding the configuration as a file allows browsers to cache the file.
Some tile images are created by http://iconogen.com.
<!-- Set the Safari pinned tab icon.
<!-- Set the manifest file for chrome splash screen
In Chrome 47 and later, a splash screen is displayed for sites launched from a homescreen.
This splashscreen is auto-generated from properties in the web app manifest, specifically:
- The icon in the icons array that is closest to 128dpi for the device.

Add an absolute linked sitemap tag.
Allways add a link to the sitemap if there is one.
<!-- Add Modernizr (ONLY USE IF ACTUALLY USING FEATURE DETECTION.)
Modernizr detects browser features and alows you to use cutting egde stuff for some with support for others.
Use a custom compiled version with only necessary feature detection for production: https://modernizr.com/download
==> TODO: check where script can be loaded and if defer or async is possible and/or useful.
The version below has all the available checks to test size ( => 94KB )
Adds support for HTML5 for IE (in this case, see use of 'lt' or 'lower than' versions lower than IE 9).
It is used in Modernizr too so delete this section is you are using Modernizr
==> TODO: check where script can be loaded and if defer or async is possible and/or useful  -->
* GOOGLE FONTS: Loading Google fonts as fast as possible for each browser capability.
==> TODO: check if this is the same for other web fonts. If it is: generalise comments to all tested webfonts.
- 1.  Preemptively warm up the fonts’ origins.
- 2.  Initiate a high-priority, asynchronous fetch for the CSS file. Works in most modern browsers.
- 3.  Initiate a low-priority, asynchronous fetch that gets applied to the page only after it’s arrived. Works in all browsers with JavaScript enabled.

- 4.  In the unlikely event that a visitor has intentionally disabled JavaScript, fall back to the original method. The good news is that, although this is a render-blocking request, it can still make use of the preconnect which makes it marginally faster than the default.
- 5.  Add url parameter text= with all URL encoded characters that use the font to make the size of the font that has to be loaded smaller.
